intro: Talinum arnotii, commonly known as the red-rooted nightshade, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers. The plant is characterized by its attractive, showy flowers that range in color from white to purple. Its leaves are usually ovate and have a slightly hairy texture. Talinum arnotii is often grown for ornamental purposes due to its vibrant blooms and unique foliage.
